messages: f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:09): I've just been asked to write an article for A List Apart, but I'm not sure what to write about
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (02:09): can you write about anything you want?
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (02:11): Did they indicate what kind of article they wanted?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (02:11): write about the google gears <-> html5 conspiracy
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:11): hah
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:12): what's the conspiracy?
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (02:12): It's not in html4, so it must be evil and proprietary
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (02:13): if there's an ala article about it, then it has to be some conspiracy ;)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:13): I'll have to learn something about google gears then
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (02:14): Maybe you could work in the privacy scare about google street view
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:15): oh, and apparently I have to organise a 3 minute presentation for Web Jam this thursday
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:15): I'm considering presenting the video element
a131216c7af242e66537a58b4ca7c9f9 (02:15): streets aren't private!? i better put some clothes on next time i walk to work.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:16): a131216c7af242e66537a58b4ca7c9f9: just keep an eye out for an unmarked vehicle with cameras on the roof.  Otherwise, you can continue walking to work naked
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (02:17): And make your cats knows how to draw the curtians
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (02:17): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: did you see h?•kons presentation on the <video> element?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (02:17): http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=5545573096553082541&q=the+video+element
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:17): oh, yeah, I think I did
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:18): where can I find a build of Opera with support for <video>?
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (02:19): labs.opera.com I think
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (02:21): entries in labs.opera.com don't have URIs?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:23): ok, now I need to find an example video (or make one). Any suggestions?  Maybe I could take one from wikipedia
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (02:24): http://people.opera.com/howcome/2007/video/three.html
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (02:24): notes that that page contains a <DOCTYPE> tag
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:46): nice! http://www.bluishcoder.co.nz/2007/05/support-for-html-video-element-in.html
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (02:56): wonders why most links that are posted in here are purple
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (03:06): does anyone know if there is any documentation available for which <video> features Opera supports in that build?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:06): .play(), .stop(), and .pause(), i think
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (03:06): see their proposal sent to the list
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (03:07): I'm considering making a video of myself lip syncing to some song for the presentaiton. Any suggestions for a song?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (03:09): http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-6739710473912337648&q=lip+syncing
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (03:10): I had one suggestion for a paris hilton song ;-)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (03:27): he wasn't specific about which one
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (03:43): hmm, it's not working with the video I created.  I converted a .mov to .ogg using ffmpeg2theora and it won't play in Opera
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (03:44): have you tried any other ogg file?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (03:44): yes, the ogg I downloaded from those Opera demos works fine
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (03:45): then i don't know
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:53): hmmm
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:54): considers the "Attribute for holding private data for scripting" thread
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:56): actually i was thinking of dumping this into my "role" folder for later consideration, but it seems this actually has some use cases
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:57): though the thread itself is free of any such information
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (03:57): what are the use cases?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:57): that's my question too
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:57): I can give you some examples
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:58): dojo widgets in markup
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:58): they want to add key/value pairs to the markup for use by script code later
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:58): class only lets you give flat values, not key-value pairs
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:58): do you have a sample uri showing this?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:58): right now they just use nonstandard attributes
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:58): let me find you some example
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:59): was also told today that dojo was supporting role="", but has yet to see an example of that either
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:59): I have no idea what that would even mean
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:00): http://dojotoolkit.org/demos/email
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:00): look at the subframe source
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:00): a brief sample from the source:

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:00): <div id="treePane" dojoType="TreeV3" toggle="wipe" toggleDuration="500" listeners="treePaneController;treePaneIcons;treePaneSelector" sizeMin="20" sizeShare="15">
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:00): <div dojoType="TreeNodeV3" title="Mail Account" nodeDocType="FolderMailbox">
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:00): <div dojoType="TreeNodeV3" title="Inbox" nodeDocType="FolderInbox"></div>

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:01): besides dojo, one assumes XBL widgets will want to be able to support some extended attribute-like key-value mechanism in the markup, without forcing the document to be nonconforming
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:01): wow, that page is an accessibility disaster
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:02): looks
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:02): that's probably why they'd like to do some role-type thing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:02): there's a hell of a lot they could do before getting there
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:03): like using actual list elements for their lists

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (04:03): I am having no luck at all.  If I encode the video using ffmepg2theora, the video won't play in Opera.  If I encode it using VLC, it will play but there's no sound :-(
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:03): it's kind of div soup
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:04): just disable styles to see what i mean
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:04): there's no reason a page should depend on css that much
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:04): to be usable
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:04): at least they use real checkboxes and buttons
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:05): anyway, point being, this is an example of a possible use case - I can't vouch for quality of their toolkit or even validity of this example
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:05): but it seems reasonable to me that for late-bound script or for XBL2 you will want something that acts like extra attributes
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:05): and it would be nice if you could do that without making your document nonconforming
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:06): yeah, i agree that there are use cases
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:06): i'm studying them to see if i can find good examples and work out what the spec should say
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:10): man, that demo page is a testament to irrelevant=""
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:12): i'm not really seeing any good examples of custom attributes here though
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:12): most of them are presentational
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:12): the rest could be folded into class=""
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:13): these pages are why i want to ban <div>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:13): god
0c613432f4687d9dae0e13d1af514eb8 (04:20): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I think the place to look for functioning role examples would be the Mozilla access pages.
0c613432f4687d9dae0e13d1af514eb8 (04:21): especially http://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Accessible_DHTML#Sample_widgets
0c613432f4687d9dae0e13d1af514eb8 (04:21): (if you want to UA support, best get yourself the accessibility toolbar from ICITA and Fire Vox)
0c613432f4687d9dae0e13d1af514eb8 (04:22): although possibly things are already working with Window-Eyes and NVDA
0c613432f4687d9dae0e13d1af514eb8 (04:22): not sure
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (04:22): http://forums.whatwg.org/viewtopic.php?t=63 - man, like 10 proposals in one post
0c613432f4687d9dae0e13d1af514eb8 (04:24): okay actually that page includes a checklist of what Window-Eyes JAWS and Zoomtext support already
0c613432f4687d9dae0e13d1af514eb8 (04:27): http://reefchat.overscore.com/ is probably the most fully developed current example

0c613432f4687d9dae0e13d1af514eb8 (04:30): information about using role in dojo is at: http://www.dojotoolkit.org/book/dojo-book-0-4/part-8-internationalization-and-accessiblity/accessibility/creating-accessible-wi
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (04:33): wonder if it's possible to split a post in phpbb
